Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic, perhaps black-figured, pottery Siana cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim above myrtle wreath frieze; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd.

For the motif of the myrtle wreath with stalks and stems, but without dots on the rims of Siana cups, see e.g. the work of the Red-black Painter (Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups III. Amsterdam 2000, 585-6, fig. 121f).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0390) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
